data.title: LAST PODCAST ON THE LEFT
data.text:
Welcome to our official website. you'll laugh, you'll fall in love, make friends and other things that don't matter in our hologram universe.

RISE FROM YOUR GRAVE!

Last Podcast on the Left barrels headlong into all things horror — as hosts Marcus Parks and Henry Zebrowski cover dark subjects spanning Jeffrey Dahmer, werewolves, Jonestown, iconic hauntings, the history of war crimes, and more. Whether it's cults, killers, or cryptid encounters, Last Podcast on the Left laughs into the abyss that is the dark side of humanity.

SEARCH SITE

YOUR HOSTS

VISIT LASTPODCASTLIVE.COM TO WATCH OUR LIVE SPECIALS

A NOTE ABOUT THE VIP TICKETS:

For future tours, we’re doing VIP a little differently from the way we’ve done it in the past. This time, we’ll be doing an intimate post-show Q&A with VIP ticket holders. And then we’ll do a group photo. Plus, you’ll get a signed tour poster.

★★★

WANT EVEN MORE CONTENT?

If you donate to our Patreon you get hours and hours of extra content: Watch LAST STREAM ON THE LEFT live every Tuesday, listen to interviews with true crime & paranormal figures, watch feature-length live show specials, get ad-free episodes of Side Stories and Last Podcast on the Left, receive presale tickets to live shows + discounts on exclusive merchandise, and MUCH MORE.

Become a patron at PATREON.COM/LASTPODCASTONTHELEFT

WATCH OUR LIVE SPECIALS AT LASTPODCASTLIVE.COM

In 2018, after touring the US with our Last Podcast on the Left stage show, we filmed it at Thalia Hall in Chicago. And then we made an entirely different show in 2019, toured that across the US and Europe and the UK, and then filmed that show in New Orleans. Both live shows are available for your viewing pleasure for $6.66 each. They’re not your average podcast live shows, check out the trailer above to see for yourself. And then go to LASTPODCASTLIVE.COM to watch four hours of ooky-spooky rip-roarin’ content.

MICHELLE NEE

Michelle has been working at LPN since 2017 as a producer, as well as administrator, studio assistant, stream tech.... ghost hunter (long story). She's from Salem, Massachusetts and enjoys making stupid things, earth tones, and music that makes you feel like a cowboy on a trusty steed name Ol' Lou.

Rob Okey

Rob Okey is an Audio Engineer and In-House Editor for Last Podcast Network since late 2020. Born and raised on Long Island, New York, with a background in TV Production, Music, and Plumbing. He's an explorer of all things strange and believes that Comedy, Paranormal, & True Crime are the trifecta to happiness.

Ian Brannan

Ian Brannan is a podcast and video editor for LPN who wants the friends he abandoned when he ran home that time they saw a UFO while playing street hockey when they were like 9, to know that he's still not sorry.

Ryan Connor

Ryan is an audio engineer and editor. When he’s not doing that he makes lots of noise and releases it as “music” under the name Sublamp. He loves dogs, books about occult teens taking weird drugs and doing ritual magic, and painting small plastic orks.

Maddie Ellis

Maddie has been with LPN since 2018 and handles artwork and socials for the network all the way from New York City. When she’s not doing that, she’s most likely on her porch, reading a stuffy philosophy book and chain-smoking. Her interests include parallel parking, people-watching, and Zoloft.

Eric Lacombe

Eric is a nice Michigan boy who once repeatedly slapped Henry’s bare ass on air while running a media conglomerate’s doomed west coast livestream studio. In 2023 he crawled out from the remains of the entertainment industry to handle livestreaming & video production for LPN. Spanking is more effective than LinkedIn.

Em Fusco

Em Fusco has been working as a researcher at LPN since late 2019. Coming from Massachusetts, their love of the paranormal came from their grandfather who had an alien encounter in his youth. When they're not yelling at their computer they can be found watching bad movies, saying "they covered this on Glee," and dabbling in witchcraft.

Joel McKeen

Joel is a researcher and co-producer of Last Podcast on the Left at LPN. They always hoped to be admired by many without having to talk to anyone. They have worked manual labor, service industry, and art jobs until 2019 when they decided they’d had enough and started reading all the books.
